title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 505.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 505.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

Whenever used in this Part, unless otherwise expressly
stated, or unless the context or subject matter requires a different meaning, the following terms shall have the respective meanings hereinafter set forth or
indicated: (a) Commissioner means the

Commissioner of Transportation of the State of New York. (b) Department means the New York State

Department of Transportation. (c) Hearing means a proceeding whereby evidence is considered and a record is
made. (d) Notice of violation means
a notice issued, pursuant to section
145
(3)
of the Transportation Law, to and against
an alleged violator of the Transportation Law, or the rules, regulations or
orders promulgated pursuant thereto. (e) Party means the department and persons
designated as petitioner, respondent or intervener in any civil administrative
enforcement proceeding subject to this Part. (f) Presiding officer means the person or
persons duly designated by the commissioner as their representative, and may
include any individual designated as an administrative law judge, for the
purpose of conducting a proceeding pursuant to section
145
of the

Transportation Law. (g) Proceeding
means an action instituted by service of a notice of violation. (h) Respondent means the party charged with
one or more violations of the Transportation Law, the rules, regulations or
orders promulgated pursuant thereto, in a civil administrative enforcement
proceeding subject to this Part. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
505.2

Amended

New

York State Register March 5, 2025/Volume XLVII, Issue 09, eff. 3/5/2025

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
